word: On May 23, Mrs. White, in an address to the college church, praised the faithfulness of Ida Magan and rebuked those who had persistently criticized the educational program. The church leader said, "Sister Magan was so weighted down with sorrow. . . . This work of opposition and dissatisfaction [concerning the college] . . . has cost the life of a wife and mother."--Ms 54, 1904, pp. 2, 3. (Remarks of Ellen G. White at Berrien Springs, May 23, 1904.) [Neff Manuscript, pp. 120-121.]
